text:
Hi all,
What do the cool kids use to build recommender systems in Python these days? I've been asked to advise a colleague at work who's working on a recommender system, but last time I worked on them was 3 years ago and I haven't kept track.
I already know and have used the Surprise library (<http://surpriselib.com/>), but I'm wondering if there's anything interesting I should be looking at (and googling doesn't seem to return much in term of recent stuff).

attachments.title: Home
attachments.text: A simple Python library for building and testing recommender systems.

Hi all,
What do the cool kids use to build recommender systems in Python these days? I've been asked to advise a colleague at work who's working on a recommender system, but last time I worked on them was 3 years ago and I haven't kept track.
I already know and have used the Surprise library (
), but I'm wondering if there's anything interesting I should be looking at (and googling doesn't seem to return much in term of recent stuff).

text: A lot of it has moved to NNs (e.g. PyTorch), though some of that is ~perhaps not necessary (e.g. <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1911.07698.pdf>)

text: Thanks, that's interesting. If anything, that paper also provides information about classical models I hadn't heard of, so it's useful also in this sense.
